author: The Equipment Receives Rf Signals Restricted Zones Like Hospital To Activate A Microcontroller For Reducing Speed
text:
Equipment receives RF signals from restricted zones to reduce speed

A system designed for automatic speed control in vehicles has won a team of students from the IFET College of Engineering, Villupuram, several prizes.

V. Sarathkumar, M. Vignesh, M. Manikandan and M. Mohammed Ameen Musthafa, designed equipments in which the Radio Frequency signals transmitted from zones like hospitals are obtained by receiver fitted in vehicles which activates a microcontroller for speed control, said a press release from the college.

The project won the first prize in competitions conducted at Prathyusha Institute of Technology and Management, Thiruvallur, SNS College of Engineering, Coimbatore and Adhiyamaan College of Engineering, Hosur.

Principal G. Mahendran, Vice-Principal and Dean Academics S. Matilda, Dean Placement and Student Affairs J. Asha and staff of the college congratulated the students.

(Reporting by

Annie Philip)
title: Speed control system brings laurels
